concept.title: Opening Beermat
concept.shortdesc: Beermat can open existing SVG Files, create new SVG files, or can be used to open and embed raster formats.

section.title: Opening Beermat by creating a new SVG
section.p:
New SVG's can be created by opening the New File Wizard, this can be accessed three
File New Other docfacto SVG
from the eclipse bar
New Other docfacto SVG
after right clicking an open project
Using the beermat shortcut, located in your eclipse toolbar, pressing this will open the new

ul.li: SVG's residing within an eclipse project will automatically be associated with beermat after installing, meaning they can be opened from any project folder and will save back to it.

SVG's outside of the eclipse workspace can also be opened using
File Open File

section.title: Opening a raster format(PNG, JPEG) with beermat
section.p: Right clicking any image file and using the open with menu to open with Beermat, will open beermat with an automatically created SVG with the image embedded in it, this will be located in the same directory as the image. This SVG can then be annotated with text and drawings, and retained as an SVG or 'saved as' raster.
